content.description:
Fun finger crack start goes left to two bolts continue up a grainy wide crack that follows with moderate and less pleasant crack moves up and right.

Fun adventure climbing with a tricky and well protected face climbing crux.
content.protection: Two bolts and a good selection and minimum number of gear from small cams to 3".  I belayed in a horizontal 0.3" - 2".  Walk off northeast to Asian Fever direction - 5 minutes.
content.location: This route is left of Fuzzy Bumper and hard to miss.

content.description: Crux at the start then a nice sustained 5.6 - 5.7 climb.
content.protection: Rap slings at top. Average rack.
content.location:
Can't find any info on the unknown or 5.8 crack climb looked at Nomads with no luck. The unknown climb is the best on the crag. I'm guessing it's 5.10a or 5.9+, easy to protect and the bolt placement is perfect.

The Fuzz Bumper is fun but beware the top block is loose below the first bolt. The new 5.8 Fuzzy Energy is a nice long 120+ route a 60 mm will make it to the bottom on the right of Fuzzy Energy. Hike in from boy scout parking lot heading towards Outer Mongolia you will see Asian Buttress on your left after about 45 mins, behind and west of Asian Buttress you will find Fuzz Bumper. Oh here is the GPS.

N34 04.155 W116 10.381

For more beta on this climb and others in this area go to

joshuatreeclimbon.com/drupaâ€¦

climbs.name: Fuzz Bumper
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Kelby burnham, Doug

content.description: Two bolts lead to a slanting crack.  This is the most obvious line on the crag, and sort of goes up the middle of the formation.
content.protection: Small to med. cams plus a couple of QDs for two bolts.
content.location: Hike up the Boy Scout Trail;  where it splits, stay to the left, and hike another maybe 10 min. You will see The Fuzz Bumper Crag on your right.  This route faces North, so you can see it until you are just past it.
